result.execSummary:
The defendant Deandre M Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Deandre M Smith is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges. On one or more other charges, Deandre M Smith was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Deandre M Smith is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Deandre M Smith was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Deandre M Smith was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consec to 07cf623, 09cm379, 10cm909.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
$268 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $250 DNA surcharge remitted.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with BMJ. Defn not to hunt or fish without appropriate licenses and agents approval.

Defn to complete CGIP successfully as recommended by agent.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.
